availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry "Woodson" Oakley (Hopkins & Webster County, Ky, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and farm laborer. North Carolina native. Married to Sarah Winstead Oakley. Father of Sarah "Sallie" E. Oakley, McDaniel Oakley, Lysander Oakley, Emily J. Oakley, William Oakley, Forest Oakley, and Mildred Oakley. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Farmer in Webster County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 121B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 610.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 1, p. 160B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Webster County, KY, June 1863, p. 15.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #29415.
